channel.title: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases
channel.description:
Requesting if somebody could make a really simple control panel sort of thing so I can create new MySQL query and also including creating databases, read/write etc., (if its possible).
Would appreciate it a lot!

item.title: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

I never used phpadmin in my life but I worked on a local webserver and found it extremely friendly.

Read full topic
item.source: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases

item.title: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:17, topic:509061”]I would suggest finding/downloading a free sql DB tool. If you are familiar with phpmyadmin then you know enough to set this program up. Set it up and connect to the database. After that its as easy as “click here to insert new table”

For this to work you’ll need to have remote access enabled on the cpanel[/quote]

Thanks for this i’ll look into it!

Read full topic
item.source: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases

item.title: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Just install the MySQL Workbench. Has everything you want without requiring a password

Read full topic
item.source: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases

item.title: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

I would suggest finding/downloading a free sql DB tool. If you are familiar with phpmyadmin then you know enough to set this program up. Set it up and connect to the database. After that its as easy as “click here to insert new table”

For this to work you’ll need to have remote access enabled on the cpanel

Read full topic
item.source: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases

item.title: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

ox random xi:

Then set up phpadmin with an account with full access and no password or just make it 123.

I wouldn’t say phpmyadmin is user friendly to somebody with no experience with it

Read full topic

item.source: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases

item.title: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Don’t forget security. Yes, not everyone is an SQL expert, but you only need one person with some knowledge to fuck up your site.

Read full topic
item.source: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases

item.title: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:11, topic:509061”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=627302.msg4263486#msg4263486 date=1363704090]

Why don’t you tell us exactly what you want to do and for what reason?
… are you aware of the drop database command?

Something similar to phpmyadmin but available for anybody using a web page (a more friendly version which does not require any username/password to access). Database drop command?

I’m not looking for something fancy or designed just plain and simple.

But what is the actual site purpose? What will the tables be used for? Or are you literally trying to recreate phpmyadmin?
[/quote]

Ease of access really since all our crap is hosted on a private network(not always online) and not everybody’s an expert at MySQL etc etc an open control panel would benefit everybody in the area, to make changes, add their own stuff and what not.[/quote]
Sounds like phpadmin to me

Read full topic
item.source: Request - Really basic control panel to edit/add MySQL databases

Why don’t you tell us exactly what you want to do and for what reason?
… are you aware of the drop database command?

Something similar to phpmyadmin but available for anybody using a web page (a more friendly version which does not require any username/password to access). Database drop command?

I’m not looking for something fancy or designed just plain and simple.
[/quote]
But what is the actual site purpose? What will the tables be used for? Or are you literally trying to recreate phpmyadmin?[/quote]

Ease of access really since all our crap is hosted on a private network(not always online) and not everybody’s an expert at MySQL etc etc an open control panel would benefit everybody in the area, to make changes, add their own stuff and what not.

Why don't you tell us exactly what you want to do and for what reason? ... are you aware of the drop database command?

I’m not looking for something fancy or designed just plain and simple.
